column2: 5. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?

column2: 6. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:

column2: 14. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 18. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 19. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:

column2: 20. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: obey signals from crossing guards.
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 21. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
